channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rich Gen Zers and millennials are investing in jewelry, sneakers and fine wine instead of traditional assets, says Bank of America
item.description: And they feel better than anyone else about the state of the economy.

item.title: Bank of England set to hold interest rates despite inflation hitting 2% target
item.description: Services inflation and wage growth both remain significantly above the level desired by monetary policymakets.

item.title: EU criticizes France for excessive debt, pressuring Macron during election
OneUnited Bank CEO: Ending slavery is the best economic decision America ever made
item.description: The decision to end slavery ultimately had the profound impact of making America the strongest country in the world, writes OneUnited Bank CEO Kevin Cohee.

item.title: Fitch pushes back China rate cut expectations to next year as Fed holds interest rates steady
item.description: Fitch now forecasts China will keep its one-year medium-term lending facility (MLF) unchanged this year at 2.5%, and cut it to 2.25% next year.

item.title: Shares of Warhammer maker Games Workshop surge on preliminary profit figures
Prada bosses want to be more like Gen Z because ‘when you get older, you overthink and limit yourself’
item.description: The bosses at Prada disagree want to be more Gen Z. Why? Because 'youth is the future'.

item.title: Putin and Kim Jong Un's relationship is a marriage of convenience: Here's how it works
item.description: The Putin-Kim meeting is focused on deepening strategic transactions — the quid pro quo — between the countries.

item.title: Taylor Swift favorite Golden Goose postpones IPO due to political upheaval in EU
Lowe's CEO went from earning $4.35 an hour at Target to being one of only 8 Black Fortune 500 CEOs with this strategy
item.description: “I had to find a way to differentiate myself,” Marvin Ellison said.

item.title: Israel warns Lebanon of prospect of ‘all-out war’ as U.S. seeks to de-escalate hostilities
item.description: Israel's foreign minister said the state is "very close to the moment of decision" over a potential escalation of hostilities with Hezbollah.

item.title: U.K. inflation falls to Bank of England's 2% target, first time since July 2021
The number of Black Fortune 500 CEOs is still abysmally low: could a DEI practice be to blame?
item.description: Corporations have touted their diversity initiatives, but may not be following through

item.title: Swiss regulator rules out UBS antitrust action over Credit Suisse deal
item.description: Switzerland's financial regulator ruled that the UBS takeover of Credit Suisse did not create any competition concerns.

item.title: Willie Mays, baseball’s electrifying ‘Say Hey Kid,’ dies at 93
